#Text=Become a Veterinary Specialist in Sonora , Arizona
#Text=Veterinarians are the doctors responsible for the diagnosis , treatment , and care of all types of animals .
#Text=After receiving their undergraduate degree , veterinarians then complete 4 years of veterinary school .
#Text=Veterinary specialists are those who specialize in a certain type of animal care such as surgery , emergency medicine , or oncology .
#Text=Although you can find work in numerous locations all over the world , read on to learn how to become a veterinary specialist in Sonora , Arizona .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Begin preparing early if you wish to become a veterinarian in Sonora , Arizona .
#Text=High school students should achieve high grades , high test scores , and try to work or volunteer in some capacity with animals .
#Text=Working at an animal clinic is an ideal way to gain experience with animal care , watch medical treatment , and to determine if the job is really what you want to do .
#Text=Graduate from a university with a bachelor 's degree , preferably with high grades and top honors .

#Text=Although technically you may graduate in any discipline , those who have degrees in any of the following may have a competitive edge when applying to veterinary school : biology , chemistry , zoology , biochemistry , animal biology , and other similar hard sciences .
#Text=Apply to veterinary school either after graduation or while in your final year of undergraduate school .
#Text=There are 28 veterinary colleges in the United States that meet the standards set forth by the American Veterinary Medical Association ( AVMA ) .
#Text=There are no veterinary schools in Arizona , so you must be prepared to attend a school in another state .

#Text=When applying to veterinary schools , you must have taken all prerequisite classes , which are usually completed while earning your undergraduate degree , and submit test scores , which include the GRE , VCAT , or MCAT .
#Text=Every school has different requirements , so you must make sure you fulfill the requirements before you apply .
#Text=Apply for an internship upon receiving your Doctor of Veterinary Medicine ( DVM ) .
#Text=Interns are typically paid very little but you gain valuable knowledge and experience that can help you secure employment in the future .
#Text=Many schools begin preparing their students for internships before they graduate .
#Text=Contact the Sonora Veterinary Specialists group , which may help you become a veterinary specialist in Sonora , Arizona .
#Text=Inquire about its internship program .
#Text=Interns will spend 12 months working the various veterinary specialties , such as surgery , neurology , dermatology , oncology , and medicine .
#Text=There are also opportunities to work with exotic animals at the Southwest Wildlife Rehabilitation Center .
#Text=Enter a residency program .
#Text=This is one of the first training periods for veterinarians after an internship .
#Text=To become board-certified in a specialty , you must complete 3 to 4 years of training in your specialty and then pass the board exams .
#Text=The AVMA currently has 39 recognized specialties .
#Text=Get your license by the Arizona State Veterinary Medicine Examination Board .
#Text=To become a veterinarian in Arizona , you must be licensed to practice in the state .
#Text=You must also pass the national North American Veterinary Licensing Exam , which is a multiple-choice test with 360 questions that cover all aspects of veterinary medicine .
#Text=Tips
#Text=As a student , you should gain as much experience as possible before and during veterinary school to have a competitive edge over your competition .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=You must make sure you have all of the requirements before becoming a vet in Arizona .
#Text=Check with the AVMA and the Arizona State Veterinary Board frequently to make sure that the specifics have not changed .
